headline: AI Has Shopping in Its Sights. Amazon Is Pushing Back.

headline: JACKSON HEWITT'S BREWITT COFFEE TRUCK RETURNS FOR THIRD YEAR, SUPPORTING LOCAL COMMUNITIES DURING TAX FILING SEASON
summary: For the third year in a row, Jackson Hewitt Tax Services® is hitting the road this tax filing season to give free coffee and tax tips during a nationwide coffee truck tour. Jackson Hewitt's Brewitt coffee truck is traveling to the country's top cities to help taxpayers get ready to file their 2025 tax return. The Brewitt coffee truck will be visiting Walmart locations nationwide with Jackson Hewitt kiosks during the entire tax filing season, starting January 14, 2026, in Los Angeles and ending i

headline: 5 Hidden AI Winners Transforming Traditional Industries in 2026
summary: While investors chase high-profile AI chip makers and tech giants, a quieter transformation is unfolding across traditional industries. Companies in healthcare, retail, financial services, and logistics are deploying AI to optimize operations, reduce costs, and improve margins. These “secret” AI plays leverage machine learning, computer vision, and agentic commerce to drive efficiency gains that show ... 5 Hidden AI Winners Transforming Traditional Industries in 2026

headline: As ‘agentic commerce’ gains ground, companies shouldn’t put too much faith in ‘GEO,’ one industry insider warns
summary: Research from AIVO Standard shows that AI models are inconsistent and unreliable in answering questions about a company's finances or governance standards, key inputs to enterprise purchasing or lending decisions

content.title: As ‘agentic commerce’ gains ground, companies shouldn’t put too much faith in ‘GEO,’ one industry insider warns
content.summary: Research from AIVO Standard shows that AI models are inconsistent and unreliable in answering questions about a company's finances or governance standards, key inputs to enterprise purchasing or lending decisions

thumbnail.caption: Earlier this week, Google rolled out new commerce features for Google Search's AI Mode and its Gemini chatbot. Brands increasingly want to monitor and control how they show up to AI agents and in AI-mediated queries. But experts warn that not all queries are the same and that AI models present risks when it comes to queries related to a company's finances or governance standards, which could influence major procurement decisions.
